channel.title: Hollyhock on Lewwwk
channel.description: Recent content in Hollyhock on Lewwwk

item.title: TechStars “Hollyhocked”
item.description:
::::: entry-content ::: {.zemanta-img .zemanta-action-click} {.alignleft decoding=“async” height=“46” width=“60”} :::

I’d heard of TechStars{.zem_slink rel=“homepage”} before and never thought too much about it – ‘another incubator’ is how I filed it. Well one of my highlights from StartupEmpire was hearing David Cohen{.zem_slink rel=“crunchbase”} of TechStars. Half-way through it struck me… why don’t we do a TechStars for Social Ventures at Hollyhock.

item.title: Reflecting on OpenEverything: the rereat, the movement, and the meaning.
item.description:
::: entry-content

It’s been almost a week since the OpenEverything retreat and the reverberations continue. Heading into it, not having any roots in the open-source community, I was technically the biggest noob on the convening team. At the same time, what drew me into the meme and the event was a sense that something bigger was going on and that that something was rooted in a set of ideals and a drive for the practical that resonated with my core and my life experiences.
